Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s first entry into that particular camp called ‘Night Of The Living Dead’ spawned nine additional movies, as well as several popular theatrical sequels by other filmmakers. With popularity apparent, studios wanted in on this trend.

After watching this movie, I couldn't help but notice the parallels between it and another film called America 3000. Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you back again to watch it.
I was repelled by this version of Esmeralda by Russell Crowe when I first saw it. Later though, I recognized that she is as much a part of the story as The Phatom and Quasi-Modo! With her

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since fled Planet Earth, for with enough money one could emigrate to Orbitals above where there seems to be plenty of dishnow meat for sale.
